snippet: Health experts for the government say there is no good reason for many Americans to keep sodium consumption below 2,300 milligrams a day, as national dietary guidelines advise.
abstract: Government health experts say there is no rationale for Americans to keep sodium consumption below 2,300 milligrams a day; United States dietary guidelines recommend that the general population aim for sodium levels of 1,500 to 2,300 milligrams a day because those levels will not raise blood pressure, but experts say it is more complicated than that.
lead_paragraph: Health experts for the government say there is no good reason for many Americans to keep sodium consumption below 2,300 milligrams a day, as national dietary guidelines advise.

headline.main: No Benefit Seen in Sharp Limits on Salt in Diet
headline.print_headline: No Benefit Seen In Sharp Limits On Salt in Diet
